messages.content: ComfyUI-AIT is an implementation of Meta's AITemplate repo in ComfyUI for faster inference using C++/CUDA.
How can I find the old AIT repo for reference?
You can find the old AIT repo for reference at https://github.com/FizzleDorf/AIT.
Where is the AIT node located in the ComfyUI interface?
The AIT node is located under loaders->AIT in the ComfyUI interface.
How can I install ComfyUI-AIT using ComfyUI Manager?
You can install ComfyUI-AIT using ComfyUI Manager by selecting and downloading it through the manager.
What are the steps to manually install ComfyUI-AIT on Linux?

To manually install ComfyUI-AIT on Linux: 1. Open a terminal in the `custom_nodes` directory. 2. Run `git clone https://github.com/FizzleDorf/ComfyUI-AIT.git`. 3. Clone AITemplate recursively. 4. Path to `cd python`. 5. Run `python setup.py bdist_wheel`. 6. Install the generated wheel file using pip. 7. Copy the `3rdparty` directory to the `Lib` directory of your Python installation.
What are the steps to manually install ComfyUI-AIT on Windows?

To manually install ComfyUI-AIT on Windows for compilation: 1. Extract the `ait_windows.zip` file. 2. Clone AITemplate recursively using the provided bundle. 3. Path to `cd ait_windows/python`. 4. Run `python setup.py bdist_wheel`. 5. Install the generated wheel file using pip. 6. Copy the `3rdparty` directory to the `Lib` directory of your Python installation.
Where can I find pre-compiled modules for ComfyUI-AIT?
You can find pre-compiled modules for ComfyUI-AIT at https://huggingface.co/Fizzledorf/AITemplateXL.
How do I use a module with the AIT_Unet_Loader in ComfyUI?

To use a module with the AIT_Unet_Loader in ComfyUI: 1. Place the downloaded or compiled module in the ComfyUI/models/ait directory. 2. In ComfyUI, hook up the AIT_Unet_Loader to your workflow. 3. Select a module that is equal to or larger than the resolution you are generating at.
